title: Apple TV hardware will get VPN access with tvOS 17
description: Don't live in the US but want Netflix to think you do? You'll be able to do so on your Apple TV this year.

title: Statement: Reddit’s defenses of changes that could kill third-party apps
description: Reddit has issued five defending statements for its upcoming policy changes that have stoked a furor.

title: Motorola Moto G 5G (2023) review: Should you buy it?
description: 5G speeds are no longer an exclusive feature on Motorola's budget-friendly Moto G.

title: Things you could buy instead of a $3,500 Apple Vision Pro, including 7 Quest 3s
description: Why buy one one of these when you could buy 1,954 tacos instead?

title: 8 features Apple ‘borrowed’ from Android for iOS 17
description: Android and iOS frequently take inspiration from each other, but here's what iOS 17 cribbed from Android.

title: Apple Vision Pro is here: A $3,499 XR headset with access to the App Store
description: Apple is ready to forge ahead into new territories, but it's only taking its most affluent customers for now.

title: watchOS 10 brings focus back to widgets for Apple Watches
description: The Digital Crown will also now let you scroll through the widgets pane.

title: Apple launches new 15-inch MacBook Air and M2 Ultra-powered Mac Studio
description: The MacBook Air finally gets a larger model, and the Mac Studio gets beefier.

title: This PS5 deal scores you God of War Ragnarök for free
description: There's over $60 off the PS5 with God of War Ragnarök for the first time ever.

title: Apple’s new M2 Ultra chip offers even more ridiculous performance than before
description: With 24 CPU cores, 76 GPU cores, and up to 192GB of RAM, you won't be yearning for more performance anytime soon.

title: Report: Average selling price of a smartphone in North America jumped $119
description: The average selling price of a smartphone in North America is now at a record high of $790.

title: The OnePlus Nord N30 5G is official, goes on pre-order in the US and Canada
description: It's expectedly a OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G rebrand, but with 50W fast charging instead of 67W.

title: The Pixel 7 Pro drops to its best price ever
description: The hottest smartphone of last year is $200 off for the first time.

title: Sitewide Reddit protest to happen on June 12 with 48 hours of shutdowns
description: Some subreddits won't come back at all until planned changes are altered or dropped.

title: This great alternative to Google Photos is free on the Play Store right now
description: Simple Gallery Pro focuses on being a good no-fuss app for offline media viewing, and it excels at that.

title: What to watch on Netflix and everything else you need to know
description: It's still the biggest streaming service in the world, and there are good reasons for it.

title: Nothing Phone 2 renders leak: Is that an iPhone 6 with LEDs?
description: What if you combined the Nothing Phone 1 with an iPhone 6? You'd apparently get the Nothing Phone 2.

title: PSA: Your Pixel Watch can turn itself off due to excessive heat
description: This isn't an unexpected safety measure, but we're still glad to see it.

title: The Galaxy Watch 6 series inches ever closer to launch
description: We get confirmation of LTE models, as you'd expect. But what else?

title: YouTube Music is getting a Spotify-style feature on Nest speakers
description: Automatic cast sessions are created between your smart speaker and phone, letting you control playback easily and seamlessly.

title: Microsoft is finally putting Cortana for Windows out of its misery
description: Microsoft is directing users to Bing Chat instead.

title: Duet AI for Google Workspace: What is it and how does it work?
description: Google has managed to beat Microsoft in the AI race for once, but it's a slim lead.
